snippet: Victims of corruption and injustice have no faith in the law, and yet they bring complaints, dreaming that an upright official will emerge to right their wrongs.
abstract: Author Yu Hua Op-Ed article describes how China has a system for filing grievances or complaints that runs parallel to, but outside, the legal system, and how, due to widespread distrust of the legal system, Chinese citizens have come to rely on filing complaints as the only way for ordinary people to exert pressure; points to the protests in Wukan as indicative of the tension that these dual systems have caused.
lead_paragraph: Victims of corruption and injustice have no faith in the law, and yet they bring complaints, dreaming that an upright official will emerge to right their wrongs.
